title: Japan, Asean Vow to Cooperate on Security Amid China Spats
description: Japan and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations pledged to work together to maintain maritime security following a summit held in Tokyo, as concerns grow about the region’s territorial spats with China.

title: Flooding in Australian Tourism Hotspot Leaves People Stranded
description: A key tourism area in Australia’s far north has been inundated with life-threatening flooding after days of torrential rainfall in the wake of a tropical cyclone.

title: Chile Rejects Second Proposed Constitution as Political Gridlock Worsens
description: Chile rejected the second proposal for a new constitution in as many years, highlighting the failure of the nation’s political system to channel social demands into a new set of basic laws.

title: Colombia Rebel Group Agrees to Halt Kidnappings in Peace Talks
description: A Colombian rebel group that kidnapped the parents of one of the country’s soccer stars in October has agreed to stop holding people for ransom as part of peace talks with the state.

title: Serbian Leader’s Party Wins Snap Ballot, Extending Dominance
description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic’s party won the most votes in an early election on Sunday, putting the Balkan leader in position to extend his decade-long dominance of the country, an early count showed.

title: White House Condemns Trump Remarks on Immigration as Un-American
description: The White House took aim Sunday at former President Donald Trump for saying immigrants are “poisoning the blood of our country,” portraying his comments as inflammatory fascist-style rhetoric that’s anathema to American democracy.

title: Argentina’s New Leader Milei Heads to Coast After Deadly Storm
description: Argentina’s President Javier Milei and some of his cabinet traveled to the country’s coast on Sunday to see the damage caused by a fatal storm.

title: Holiday Cheer for Biden, Markets: Sunday US Briefing
description: Get ready for the new week.

title: Canada to Announce 2035 All-EV Sales Mandate, Reports Say
description: The Canadian government is poised to pass rules requiring all new vehicles sold in the country to be zero-emissions by 2035, according to news reports.

title: Fed’s Goolsbee Says Too Early to Declare Victory Over Inflation
description: Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said it’s too early to declare victory in the central bank’s inflation fight, and decisions on interest-rate cuts will be based on incoming economic data.

title: US Senators Seeking Ukraine Aid Deal See Progress on Border Policy
description: Two senators said negotiations on US border security are moving forward as Republicans demand more restrictive policies in exchange for clearing assistance to Ukraine and other US allies.

title: Biden Stands to Lose More to Third-Party Candidates Than Trump Does
description: Third-party candidates are emerging as a potentially crucial obstacle to reassembling Joe Biden’s winning 2020 election coalition, particularly younger voters, in the battleground states likely to decide the US presidency.

title: Egypt’s Suez Canal Authority Says Monitoring Tensions in Red Sea
description: Egypt’s Suez Canal Authority said it’s “closely following” tensions in the Red Sea and any impact on canal crossings, after Yemeni militant attacks on vessels hundreds of miles to the south prompted major shipping lines to temporarily avoid the region.

title: Top DeSantis Strategist Quits Group Backing His Presidential Bid
description: Longtime Republican strategist Jeff Roe resigned from the super political action committee supporting Ron DeSantis’ presidential bid, the latest personnel shakeup in the Florida governor’s operation just weeks before 2024 voting begins.

title: Fed Rate-Cut Pivot Is Welcome News for Biden, But Carries Pitfalls for Powell
description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s pivot toward interest-rate cuts is spreading holiday cheer in the White House, where the improved prospects for an economic soft landing are a boon for President Joe Biden’s bid for another term.

title: Sunak Gets Another Grilling From a Key Panel: UK Sunday Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter.

title: Chileans Again Vote on New Constitution, This Time a ‘Business Friendly’ One
description: Chileans are heading to the polls in a second attempt to approve a new constitution and move past the period of political and economic uncertainty set off by the charter’s rewrite four years ago.

title: UK, Germany Call for ‘Sustainable Cease-Fire’ in Gaza
description: RAFAH, GAZA - DECEMBER 17: Civil defense teams carry out search and rescue operations under debris of destroyed buildings after Israeli airstrike in Rafah, Gaza on December 17, 2023. (Photo by Abed Rahim Khatib/Anadolu via Getty Images)

title: Thousands Flee as Sudan’s Civil War Spreads to Crucial Aid Hub
description: Fighting spread to a Sudanese city crucial to international aid efforts, forcing about 15,000 people to flee and threatening to deepen a humanitarian disaster caused by the eight-month-old civil war.

title: Hong Kong Puts No. 1 National Security Target Jimmy Lai on Trial
description: After more than 1,000 days in prison, the biggest target in Hong Kong’s crackdown on dissent, Jimmy Lai, will finally go on trial this week in a case closely scrutinized by Western governments.

title: Serbia’s Populists Aim to Tighten Grip on Power in Tense Election
description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Serbia's populist President Aleksandar Vucic is looking to further tighten his grip on power in an election on Sunday that has been marred by reports of major irregularities during a tense campaign.

title: Russians See Egg Prices Soar Ahead of Holidays and Elections
description: The price Russians pay for eggs has surged amid reports of shortages in some regions, prompting criticism from President Vladimir Putin and government action to secure supplies of the staple ingredient that’s used in many favorite holiday dishes.

title: Israel Faces Protests, New Calls for Truce After Hostage Deaths
description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel's government faced local protests and calls for a cease-fire from some of its closest European allies on Sunday after a series of shootings, including of three hostages who were waving a white flag, added to mounting concerns about its conduct in the 10-week-old war in Gaza.

title: Japan Leader’s Support Drops After Replacing Scandal-Hit Cabinet
description: Support for Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida fell to fresh lows in polls taken after he reshuffled his cabinet to contain a funding scandal that threatens the future of his government.

title: Russia Says 35 Ukrainian Drones Downed in New Wave of Attacks
description: Russia said it intercepted 35 Ukrainian drones in a fresh wave of attacks, a day after repelling one of the heaviest UAV swarms in weeks.

title: Kuwait Has a New Ruler Who Now Must Fix Its Old Problems
description: Like his immediate predecessor, Kuwait’s new ruler is taking over in his 80s and will be confronted with the same economy-hobbling political dysfunction that has for years doomed reforms.

title: Over 60 people have drowned in the capsizing of a migrant vessel off Libya, the UN says
description: CAIRO (AP) — A boat carrying dozens of migrants trying to reach Europe capsized off the coast of Libya, leaving more than 60 people dead, including women and children, the U.N. migration agency said.
